column2: voce mea ad Dòminum deprecátus sum. ^ I cried to the Lord with my voice~; with my voice I made supplication to the Lord.

column1: 3 ^ Effùndo in conspèctu ejus deprecațiónem meam
column2: et tribulațiónem meam ante ìpsum pronúnțio. ^ In his sight I pour out my supplication
column3: and before him I declare my trouble.

column1: 4 ^ In deficièndo ex me spíritum meum
column2: et tu cognovìsti sémitas meas. In via hac qŭa ambulábam absconduérunt láqŭeum mìhi. ^ When my spirit failed me
column3: then thou knewest my paths. In this way wherein I walked
column4: they have hidden a snare for me.

column3: et non èrat qŭi cognósceret me. Perívit fuǧéla a me
column4: et non est qŭi reqŭírat ánimam meam. ^ I looked on my right hand
column6: and there was no one that would know me. Flight hath failed me
column7: and there is no one that hath regard to my soul.

column4: pórțio mea in terra vivèntium.~»^ I cried to thee
column7: my portion in the land of the living."

column2: qŭia humiliátus sum nìmis. Líbera me a perseqŭèntibus me
column3: qŭia confortáti sunt super me. ^ Attend to my supplication
column4: for I am brought very low. Deliver me from my persecutors
column5: for they are stronger than I.

column1: 8 ^ Edúce de custódia ánimam meam ad confitèndum nómini tuo~; me expèctant justi donec retrìbuas mìhi. ^ Bring my soul out of prison
column2: that I may praise thy name~; the just wait for me
